intro: Pimpinella rotunda, commonly known as the round-leaf cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive round, heart-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. Its fruits are small, dry schizocarps that split into two parts upon maturity. Pimpinella rotunda is often found in woodland habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
